10.1177/0894439313506837.title: Measuring Moral Rhetoric in Text
10.1177/0894439313506837.author: Sagi, Eyal and Dehghani, Morteza
10.1177/0894439313506837.paperMotivationText: Sentiment analysis methods in computer sciecne are, for the most part, not grounded in psychological theories, and rely merely on word co-occurrences. On the other hand, theories of morality in psychology have been almost entirely developed and tested using self-report surveys.
10.1177/0894439313506837.paperContributionText: The authors use a method based on dictionary and word similarity to measure the moral loading of concepts as they are used in corpora. They apply their method in three case studies/corpora.
10.1177/0894439313506837.paperResultsText: Their analyses show confirm expectations about the use of moral rhetoric by Democrats and Republicans in political discourse.
10.1177/0894439313506837.resourcesOtherText: The New York Times annotated corpus (Sanhaus 2008), corpus of blog posts from Deghani et al. 2014 "Analyzing political rhetoric in conservative and liberal weblogs related to the construction of the “ground zero mosque”", transcripts of US Senate speeches (Yu et al 2008)
